Prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird

content:
If you are referring to the Primary Password, we do not have it, nor can it be retrieved from Thunderbird. To recover the accounts, do this: 

Choose Tools -> Developer Tools > Error Console, paste the expression:    openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")     and press the Evaluate button. That will open a dialog asking you if you want to reset your password. If Evaluate is not seen, press enter key. When prompted, press the Reset button.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password#w_resetting-your-primary-password-if-you-have-forgotten-it

NOTE: Doing this removes passwords from accounts, so they will need to be reentered.

creator: davidsk

content:
Pop accounts can be created as 'deferred' accounts which is commonly known as 'Global Inbox(Local Folders). That means you do not see the individual pop mail accounts in Folder Pane because they are all directing all incoming to the account called 'Local Folders', where they share the same Inbox etc.

Imap accounts work differently as they can only display whatever is on the server. That means imap folders synchronise with server folders so it's not possible to create them as 'deferred accounts'.

However, Thunderbird offers various 'views' of the Folder Pane and one of them is called 'Unified Folders'. This works the same for pop or imap accounts.

All the default folders get a 'Unified Folder' eg: Unified Inbox and this has subfolders displaying the inboxes of the various accounts - if you need to see that as well. The 'Unified Inbox' is a virtual folder and it works like a filter displaying all emails that are located in all Inboxes in all accounts.

Any folders you create are not default and so they are displayed separately in the mail account name folder listed at the below the default folders. The Unified Folder - right click 'properties' - is where you can choose which account eg: Inbox' in included/excluded.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
re :about a dozen hotmail accounts

Microsoft have altered a load of stuff recently. Now, you have all the hotmail accounts listed as 'alias' accounts. Oauth you already know about, but they have also messed about with passwords - all alias email addresses must use same password as Microsoft Account. In addition, only the account/email address et up as 'primary' can be used as the smtp outgoing server username.


1. Your microsoft account and your hotmail/outlook/msn/live account all need to have the same password. So all your microsoft accounts need to be using same password. Info at this link says:

  • https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/office/how-to-sign-in-to-hotmail-c378938b-c0eb-40c1-b99e-338dd9e776a8

Can't sign in to Hotmail or Outlook.com? Notes: Your Hotmail or Outlook.com password is the same as your Microsoft Account password.

You must logon to the webmail account via browser to sort it out. Once all your accounts are using same password.....

2 In microsoft account accessed via a browser If you have more email addresses or hotmail addresses etc , microsoft now regard one is 'primary' and all others are alias to the account. This is not a problem when it comes to receiving mail, but can be an issues when you want to send. When it comes to 'sending' - that is smtp in Thunderbird - it can only send using the 'primary' email address. You can choose what you want to be set as 'primary', but whatever email address you set up as 'primary' - only that email address can be used for SMTP. So if you want to send using hotmail email address then make sure it is set up as the primary email address. But then if you have an outlook.com account as well, it will only be able to send using the hotmail primary email address. So choose the email address which you want to set up as 'primary'. If you have several 'hotmail' addresses, incoming is no problem, but that primary hotmail address has to be used as the outgoing smtp for all accounts.

3. In Thunderbird, Cookies must be enabled in order to set up Oauth.

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Check under Web Content -
  • Select: 'Accept cookies from sites'
  • Accept third party cookies' 'Always'
  • Click on 'Exceptions' button next to Accept cookies from sites to make sure you are not blocking cookies from Microsoft sites, such as :hotmail.com, outlook.com, office365.com, www.live.com, www.msn.com

4. In Thunderbird....When creating account or if account is created but you need to check server settings: Account Settings must use the following: Server Type: POP Mail Server

  • Server Name: outlook.office365.com
  • Port 995
  • User Name: xxxx@hotmail.com
  • Connection Security: SSL/LTS
  • Authentication Method: OAuth2

Server Type: IMAP Mail Server

  • Server Name: outlook.office365.com
  • Port 993
  • User Name: xxxx@hotmail.com
  • Connection Security: SSL/LTS
  • Authentication Method: OAuth2

SMTP:

  • Server Name: smtp.office365.com
  • Port: 587
  • Connection Security: STARTTLS
  • Authentication method: OAuth2
  • User Name: example@hotmail.com (Please note this must be whatever email address is set up as the 'primary' email address)


Once you have all these settings and got the password sorted.

Restart Thunderbird When you get the Microsoft pop up window asking for password, type it in and click on 'Sign in'. You may then get another window asking to allow Thunderbird access to server - click on 'Accept'
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
IF you have only used POP before and want to use IMAP now - either way please check the webmail account is actually set up to allow pop and imap.

Check this: Have you enabled POP or IMAP etc access in the hotmail webmail account? Located this info in Microsoft help pages: Enabled Pop or IMAP access in Outlook.com (so it should be the same for all of the microsoft bunch of accounts - hotmail, msn, live, outlook etc) If you want to use POP or IMAP to access your email in Outlook.com, you'll first need to enable access in webmail account via a browser.

  • Logon to webmail
  • Select Settings > Mail > Forwarding and IMAP.
  • Under POP and IMAP, toggle the slider for Let devices and apps use POP or Let devices and apps use IMAP to ON depending on the account you are enabling.
  • Select Save.


When creating hotmail account in Thunderbird.

  • Menu app icon > New Account > Email
  • Enter name
  • Enter hotmail email address
  • Enter password
  • select chceckbox to remember password
  • Click on 'Continue'

Thunderbird by default is looking for Imap settings, so if you want pop you will need to use 'Config Manually'. You might get a set up error for non primary email addresses because smtp now needs to be different for non primary email addresses.

  • Click on 'Configure Manually' button

If you want to swap to POP then select the Protocol as Pop. Make sure all the server settings are adjusted for Pop. This generally effects the Port number. If account is NOT primary email address, then in SMTP set 'username' as the primary email address. Or create the mail account and then you have to alter this in Account Settings so all hotmail/outlook/msn/live microsoft accounts are using the SMTP where username = email address of whatever you set up as 'primary'. Otherwise you will get smtp failure to send. Click on 'Re-test' and click on 'Done' to create account.

content: Ok, I am unsure of the details, so let's verify profile location. 1- click help>troubleshootinginformation, 2- scroll down to 'profile folder' on left side and click 'open profile' 3- you are now in Windows File Explorer. Note location of profile. back up one click to the folder named 'Profile.' If there is more than one profile listed, your missing components are probably in the profile not in use. the contacts is a file named abook.sqlite and the messages will be in the Imapmail\<acccount> folder for IMAP, or the Mail\,accountname> for POP. If not found, and if profile is not on drive c, then the missing profile is probably on drive c at c. Look for c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles\<yourprofile>. Messages will be in sets, such as inbox, inbox.msf, sent, sent.msf. Ignore the msf entries. 4- To install the contacts and messages, do this: - for addressbook, just click tools>import and follow address book options to import sqlite and then select the desired file. - for messages, I suggest using the addon, importexporttools NG. then, highlight Local Folders, rightclick, select the importexport option to import mbox and select one of the message files to save. repeat for each message file.

content: This hints of a problem in saving file to hard drive. Thunderbird saves settings in prefs.js, a file in the profile. It does that when closing and, there is an error in saving, when thunderbird restarts, it uses the prior setup. You might check in profile to see if that file is read-only. Problems can also happen if a VPN or antivirus is interfering with thunderbird. You might see multiple copies of prefs. js, such as prefs-1.js, prefs-2.js, etc. In that case, the one with highest number 'may' be the one with latest settings. If the update date reflects that, you could delete all prefs.js files except the highest one, and rename it to prefs.js. These are simple text files, so you could also browse them for content.
